settings.points:
• Formulated by top fertility doctors
  • Helps prepare your body for pregnancy
  • Supports Egg Health

  • Supports Early-Stage Pregnancy

settings.infoHeading: A Look Inside Your "Pre" Prenatal Vitamin Pack
settings.infoParagraph: Conception Support Pack* is specifically made to prepare your body for pregnancy. Most prenatal vitamins are one-size-fits-all, and don’t consider the unique nutrient needs of this chapter.*
settings.left:
Not ready to get pregnant right now? Don't worry,
this pack is for you!
settings.right: Our medical panel recommends taking our Conception Support Pack* at least 6 months before you’re ready to begin trying to get pregnant.

settings.iconInfo: Your complete vitamin routine to prepare your body  for pregnancy and support fertility—all in one daily pack.

settings.testimonialHeading: Let’s talk about some of the other ways to support your fertility—
settings.testimonialSubHeading: in addition to a conception vitamin routine.
settings.testimonialContent1:
What to Do:

Check in with your doctor.
Together, you can make sure there are no imbalances or irregularities to address, and make a plan to go off hormonal birth control if you’re on it.
settings.testimonialContent2:
What to Eat:

Follow the conception diet.
Prioritize balanced, nutritious meals and nutrients that support fertility, like folate.
settings.testimonialContent3:
What to Avoid:

Cut back on vices like smoking  and alcohol.
These habits can have a negative impact on fertility.

settings.overlapContext1: Tracking your menstrual cycle is a crucial step when you’re planning for pregnancy— to ensure that you’re addressing any irregularities, and so that you know when you’re most fertile.
settings.overlapContext2: To start, let’s learn about when during your cycle you’re most likely to get pregnant.

settings.quoteText1: I’ve been taking hormonal birth control— will that impact my chances?
settings.quoteText2: “No, that’s an old wive’s tale. Birth control pills these days are very low-dose and they’re very reversible. By stopping hormonal birth control, a woman should be able to get pregnant very easily and it doesn’t matter if she’s been on two weeks of birth control or ten years.”

settings.comparisonTitle: You and your body deserve the best—
settings.comparisonText1:
That means relying on a vitamin regimen with the highest-quality ingredients.
But cobbling that routine together on your own can be time-consuming—and expensive.
settings.oneVone: If you purchased similar vitamins individually, it would cost 203% more.
